titleInfo.title: Sgt. K. C. Henry of Lafayette takes down the Tennessee state flag, circa 1990 November 15

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219.

mods.abstract: A photograph of Sgt. K. C. Henry of Lafayette, Tenn. who prepares to take down the Tennessee state flag from its makeshift but sturdy flagpole at a campsite in Saudi Arabia during Operation Desert Shield. The campsite, nicknamed "Hotel California" because of its tennis court and a cracked swimming pool, was home to the 1175th Quartermaster Company of the Tennessee National Guard, based out of Carthage and Lafayette, Tenn. The unit was leaving "Hotel California" in mid-November 1990 for a new location further north toward Kuwait. The photograph was taken by Nashville Banner photographer Larry McCormack on assignment in Saudi Arabia in November 1990. Forms part of the Nashville Banner Archives. 1 photograph transparency : col ; 35mm.
